article_title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ premier ratings down from last year
article_text: Saturday Night Live opened its 40th season last night with a 4.0 rating in metered-market households and a 2.1 in adults 18-49 in the Local People Meters. The show, hosted by Chris Pratt, was down 14% in households and down 22% in 18-49 from last fall’s premiere hosted by Tina Fey but equaled the numbers for the May finale hosted by another SNL alum, Andy Samberg.

twitter.description: 'Saturday Night Live' ratings for its 40th season premiere and starring Chris Pratt were down from a year ago, but even with May's finale.

article_metadata.trueanthem.headline: ‘Saturday Night Live’ Premiere Hosted By Chris Pratt Down From Last Fall Opener, On Par With May Finale

article_summary:
Saturday Night Live opened its 40th season last night with a 4.0 rating in metered-market households and a 2.1 in adults 18-49 in the Local People Meters.
The show, hosted by Chris Pratt, was down 14% in households and down 22% in 18-49 from last fall’s premiere hosted by Tina Fey but equaled the numbers for the May finale hosted by another SNL alum, Andy Samberg.
